meanings.definition: To cook or heat a hotdog
meanings.sent1: She hotdogged the sausages on the grill for the picnic.
meanings.sent2: I always hotdogged my hotdogs over the campfire when camping.
meanings.sent3: The chef hotdogged the franks with precision, making them sizzle just right.
meanings.sent4: The sun hotdogged the hotdog, turning it a perfect golden brown.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the hotdog being hotdogged filled the air, making everyone hungry.

meanings.sent1: He hotdogged his way into getting free tickets to the concert.
meanings.sent2: The scammer hotdogged unsuspecting victims into giving away their personal information.
meanings.sent3: The magician hotdogged the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her smooth talking hotdogged the jury into believing her story.
meanings.sent5: The con artist hotdogged his mark, leaving them with empty pockets.

meanings.definition: To perform in a showy or ostentatious manner
meanings.sent1: The singer hotdogged on stage, captivating the audience with her performance.
meanings.sent2: The actor hotdogged during the play, stealing the spotlight with every line.
meanings.sent3: The dancer hotdogged across the stage, leaving everyone in awe of her moves.
meanings.sent4: The athlete hotdogged during the game, scoring points with flair.
meanings.sent5: The performer hotdogged with such charisma that the crowd couldn't look away.
